page.title: 03Local Building Styles
page.content: The area exhibits three distinctive and interesting building styles. (1) {Bedlington Front Street East)}contains many dwellings constructed in the l9th century and earlier. Many original features remain especially the heavy oak doors, supporting pillars, ornamental brackets & archways for wagons & coaches. Once trade was carried on through the many side streets, but now some of these have been blocked up. eg. Bell's Place (2) Successful attempts have been made lately to preserve the original character of this area in the {new {development}by using stone facing & roof tiling. {Milfield Court & {Wansbeck Court}at the lower end blend in well with original front street. (3) {Pit Rows} (Colliery Housing) are most clearly to be seen in the isolated community of {East Hartford}
